verb.description: Show or prove to be right or reasonable.
examples: the person appointed has fully justified our confidence

verb.description: Declare or make righteous in the sight of God.
Adjust (a line of type or piece of text) so that the print fills a space evenly or forms a straight edge at one or both margins.

origin: Middle English (in the senses administer justice to and inflict a judicial penalty on): from Old French justifier, from Christian Latin justificare do justice to, from Latin justus (see just).
